New Records: Pablo López reached the first 200-strikeout season of his career.
López joined Johan Santana as the only pitchers in Twins history to make a scoreless start with at least 14 strikeouts and no walks.
López's outing pushed him to a career-high 213 strikeouts for the season, the most by any Twins pitcher since Santana fanned 235 in 2007.
López became the ninth Twins pitcher to reach the 200-strikeout threshold, and the first since José Berríos in 2018.
Key Match Events: Pablo López dazzled for eight scoreless innings against the Mets while fanning a career-high 14 batters.
The Twins couldn’t take advantage of López’s historic performance due to a lack of run support, falling short of a sweep with a 2-0 loss to the Mets.
Post-Match Reflections: Pablo López expressed pride in reaching the strikeout mark and emphasized the importance of understanding his strengths as a pitcher.
Manager Rocco Baldelli praised López's performance and highlighted his impressive season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins had already secured their third consecutive series victory to begin September.
The loss didn't hurt the Twins in terms of the standings, with the second-place Guardians losing to the Angels on Sunday afternoon.
